page.title: 19Law and Order in Southam
page.content: Southam's{Magistrates' Court}is next door to the police station. Sessions are held at the court on Monday for adults and Thursday for juveniles and are presided over by 3 magistrates. In addition to offices the{police {station}has 2 cells and a printer room where messages can be received and transmitted. In addition to a Granada and 2 Escort police cars a push bike has recently been acquired bringing policemen "back on the beat" Southam is to try to establish a {Neighbourhood Watch}scheme which would reduce local opportunities for crime and help to develop a good community spirit. Neighbours will look out for anything suspicious and will report to co-ordinators (people who normally spend long periods at home). They will then pass on the information to the police to be dealt with accordingly.
